37.verse: He will ·look at [examine] the ·mildew [or mold; disease], and if the ·mildew [or mold; disease] on the walls of the house is green or red and goes into the wall’s surface,

38.verse: he must go out and close up the house for seven days.

39.verse: On the seventh day the priest must come back and check the house. If the ·mildew [or mold; disease] has spread on the walls of the house,

40.verse: the priest must order the people to tear out the stones with the ·mildew [or mold; disease] on them. They should throw them away, at a certain unclean place outside the city.

41.verse: Then the priest must have all the inside of the house scraped. The people must throw away the plaster they scraped off the walls, at a certain unclean place outside the city.

42.verse: Then the owner must put new stones in the walls, and he must cover the walls with new clay plaster.

43.verse: “Suppose a person has taken away the old stones and plaster and put in new stones and plaster. If ·mildew [or mold; disease] again appears in his house,

44.verse: the priest must come back and check the house again. If the ·mildew [or mold; disease] has spread in the house, it is a ·mildew [or mold; 13:47] that destroys things; the house is unclean [in a ritual sense].

45.verse: Then the owner must tear down the house, remove all its stones, plaster, and wood, and take them to the unclean place outside the city.

46.verse: Anyone who goes into that house while it is closed up will be unclean until evening.

47.verse: Anyone who eats in that house or lies down there must wash his clothes.

48.verse: “Suppose after new stones and plaster have been put in a house, the priest checks it again and the ·mildew [or mold; disease] has not spread. Then the priest will announce that the house is clean [in a ritual sense], because the ·mildew [or mold; disease] is gone.

49.verse: “Then, to make the house clean [in a ritual sense], the priest must take two birds, a piece of cedar wood, a piece of red string, and a hyssop plant.

50.verse: He will ·kill [slaughter] one bird in a clay bowl containing fresh water.

51.verse: Then he will take the bird that is still alive, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the red string, and he will dip them into the blood of the bird that was ·killed [slaughtered] over the fresh water. The priest will sprinkle the blood on the house seven times.

52.verse: He will use the bird’s blood, the fresh water, the live bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the red string to make the house clean.

53.verse: He will then go to an open field outside the city and let the living bird go free. This is how the priest makes the house clean and ·ready for service to the LORD [makes atonement for the house].”

54.verse: These are the ·teachings [regulations; laws] about any kind of skin disease [13:2],

55.verse: ·mildew [or mold] on pieces of cloth or in a house,

56.verse: swellings, rashes, or bright spots on the skin;

57.verse: they help people decide when things are unclean [in a ritual sense] and when they are clean. These are the ·teachings [regulations; laws] about all these kinds of diseases.

1.verse: Rules About a Person’s Body - The LORD also said to Moses and Aaron,

2.verse: “Say to the ·people [sons; children] of Israel: ‘When ·a fluid comes from a person’s body [any man has a discharge from his genitals/flesh], the ·fluid is [discharge makes him] unclean [in a ritual sense].

3.verse: It doesn’t matter if the ·fluid [discharge] flows freely or if it is blocked from ·flowing [discharging]; the ·fluid [discharge] will make him unclean. This is the way the ·fluid [discharge] makes him unclean:

4.verse: “‘If the person ·who discharges the body fluid [with the discharge] lies on a bed, that bed becomes unclean [in a ritual sense], and everything he sits on becomes unclean.

5.verse: Anyone who touches his bed must wash his clothes and bathe in water, and the person will be unclean until evening.

6.verse: Whoever sits on something that the person ·who discharges the fluid [with the discharge] sat on must wash his clothes and bathe in water; he will be unclean until evening.

7.verse: Anyone who touches the person ·who discharges the body fluid [with the discharge] must wash his clothes and bathe in water; he will be unclean until evening.

8.verse: “‘If the person ·who discharges the body fluid [with the discharge] spits on someone who is clean [in a ritual sense], that person must wash his clothes and bathe in water; he will be unclean until evening.

9.verse: Everything on which the person who is unclean sits when riding [specifically a saddle] will become unclean.

10.verse: Anyone who touches something that was under him will be unclean until evening. And anyone who carries these things must wash his clothes and bathe in water; he will be unclean until evening.

11.verse: “‘If the person ·who discharges a body fluid [with a discharge] has not washed his hands in water and touches another person, that person must wash his clothes and bathe in water; he will be unclean [in a ritual sense] until evening.

12.verse: “‘If a person ·who discharges a body fluid [with a discharge] touches a clay bowl, that bowl must be broken. If he touches a wooden bowl, that bowl must be washed in water.

13.verse: “‘When a person ·who discharges a body fluid [with a discharge] is made clean [in a ritual sense], he must count seven days for himself for his cleansing. He must wash his clothes and bathe his body in fresh water, and he will be clean.

14.verse: On the eighth day he must take two doves or two young pigeons before the LORD at the entrance of the Meeting Tent. He will give the two birds to the priest.

15.verse: The priest will offer the birds, one for a sin [or purification; 4:3] offering and the other for a burnt offering [1:1–17]. And the priest will make that person clean ·so he can belong to the LORD again [and make atonement for him].

16.verse: “‘If semen [considered holy due to its association with life] goes out from a man, he must bathe in water; he will be unclean [in a ritual sense] until evening [contact with something holy also rendered a person unclean].

17.verse: If the fluid gets on any clothing or leather, it must be washed with water; it will be unclean until evening.

18.verse: “‘If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with a woman [presumably his wife] and ·semen comes out [has an emission of semen], both people must bathe in water; they will be unclean [in a ritual sense] until evening.

19.verse: Rules About a Woman’s Body - “‘When a woman has ·her monthly period [a discharge of blood from her genitals/body], she is unclean [in a ritual sense; the blood’s association with reproduction makes it holy; 15:16] for seven days; anyone who touches her will be unclean until evening.

20.verse: Anything she lies on during this time will be unclean, and everything she sits on during this time will be unclean.

21.verse: Anyone who touches her bed must wash his clothes and bathe in water; that person will be unclean until evening.

22.verse: Anyone who touches something she has sat on must wash his clothes and bathe in water; that person will be unclean until evening.

23.verse: It does not matter if the person touched the woman’s bed or something she sat on; he will be unclean until evening.

24.verse: “‘If a man ·has sexual relations with a woman [lies with her] and her ·monthly period [discharge] touches him, he will be unclean [in a ritual sense] for seven days; every bed he lies on will be unclean.

25.verse: “‘If a woman has a ·loss [discharge] of blood for many days and it is not during her regular monthly period, or if she continues to have a ·loss [discharge] of blood after her regular period, she will be unclean [in a ritual sense], as she is during her monthly period. She will be unclean for as long as she continues to bleed [Matt. 9:20; Mark 5:25; Luke 8:43].

26.verse: Any bed she lies on during all the time of her ·bleeding [discharge] will be like her bed during her regular monthly period. Everything she sits on will be unclean, as during her regular monthly period.

27.verse: “‘Whoever touches those things will be unclean [in a ritual sense] and must wash his clothes and bathe in water; he will be unclean until evening.

28.verse: When the woman becomes clean from her ·bleeding [discharge], she must ·wait [count] seven days, and after this she will be clean.

29.verse: Then on the eighth day she must take two doves or two young pigeons and bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Meeting Tent.

30.verse: The priest must offer one bird for a sin [or purification; 4:3] offering and the other for a whole burnt offering [1:1–17]. In this way the priest will make her clean so she can belong to the LORD again [and make atonement for her].

31.verse: “‘So you must warn the ·people [sons; children] of Israel to stay separated from things that make them unclean [in a ritual sense]. If you don’t warn the people, they might make my ·Holy Tent [Tabernacle] unclean, and then they would have to die!’”

32.verse: These are the ·teachings [laws; instructions] for the person who ·discharges a body fluid [has a discharge] and for the man who becomes unclean [in a ritual sense] from ·semen coming out of his body [an emission of semen].

33.verse: These are the ·teachings [laws; regulations] for the woman who becomes unclean from her monthly period, for a man or woman who has a discharge, and for a man who ·becomes unclean by having sexual relations [lies] with a woman who is unclean.

1.verse: The Day of Cleansing - Now two of Aaron’s sons had died ·while offering incense to [when they drew near to/approached] the LORD, and after that time the LORD spoke to Moses.

2.verse: The LORD said to him, “Tell your brother Aaron that there are times when he cannot go ·behind [inside] the curtain ·into the Most Holy Place [before the mercy seat/atonement cover; Ex. 25:17–22] where the Ark is. If he goes in when I appear in a cloud over the ·lid on the Ark [mercy seat; atonement cover], he will die.

3.verse: “This is how Aaron may enter the Most Holy Place: Before he enters, he must offer a bull for a ·sin [or purification; 4:3] offering and a ·male sheep [ram] for a whole burnt offering [1:1–17].

4.verse: He must put on the holy linen inner robe [Ex. 28:39–41], with the linen underclothes [Ex. 28:42–43] next to his body. His belt will be the cloth belt [sash], and he will wear the linen turban. These are holy clothes, so he must bathe his body in water before he puts them on.

5.verse: “Aaron must take from the ·people [sons; children] of Israel two male goats for a sin [or purification; 4:3] offering and one ·male sheep [ram] for a burnt offering [1:1–17].

6.verse: Then he will offer the bull for the ·sin [or purification; 4:3] offering ·for himself to remove sins from him and his family so they will belong to the LORD [to make atonement for him and for his family/house].

7.verse: “Next Aaron will take the two goats and bring them before the LORD at the entrance to the Meeting Tent.

8.verse: He will throw lots for the two goats—one will be for the LORD and the other for ·the goat that removes sin [the scapegoat; Azazel; meaning uncertain; perhaps a geographical name].

9.verse: Then Aaron will take the goat that was chosen for the LORD by throwing the lot, and he will offer it as a ·sin [or purification; 4:3] offering.

10.verse: The other goat, which was chosen by lot ·to remove the sin [as the scapegoat; for Azazel to make atonement], must be brought alive before the LORD. The priest will use it to perform the acts that remove Israel’s sin so they will belong to the LORD. Then this goat will be sent out into the ·desert [wilderness] ·as a goat that removes sin [as the scapegoat; to Azazel].

11.verse: “Then Aaron will offer the bull as a ·sin [or purification; 4:3] offering for himself, ·to remove the sins from him and his family so they will belong to the LORD [to make atonement for himself and his family]; he will ·kill [slaughter] the bull for the ·sin [or purification; 4:3] offering for himself.

12.verse: Then he must take a pan full of burning coals from the altar before the LORD and two handfuls of sweet incense that has been ground into powder. He must bring it into the room ·behind [inside] the curtain.

13.verse: He must put the incense on the fire before the LORD so that the cloud of incense will cover the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover; Ex. 25:17–22] on the ·Ark [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony; Ex. 25:10]. Then when Aaron comes in, he will not die.

14.verse: Also, he must take some of the blood from the bull and sprinkle it with his finger on the front of the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover]; with his finger he will sprinkle the blood seven times in front of the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover].

15.verse: “Then Aaron must ·kill [slaughter] the goat of the ·sin [or purification; 4:3] offering for the people and bring its blood into the room ·behind [inside] the curtain. He must do with the goat’s blood as he did with the bull’s blood, sprinkling it on the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover] and in front of the ·lid [mercy seat; atonement cover].

16.verse: Because the ·people [sons; children] of Israel have been unclean [in a ritual sense], Aaron will ·perform the acts to make the Most Holy Place ready for service to the LORD [make atonement for the sanctuary]. Then it will be clean from the sins and crimes of the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel]. He must also do this for the Meeting Tent, because it stays in the middle of unclean people.

17.verse: When Aaron makes ·the Most Holy Place ready for service to the LORD [atonement for the sanctuary], no one is allowed in the Meeting Tent until he comes out. So Aaron will ·perform the acts to remove sins from [make atonement for] himself, his family, and all the ·people [assembly; crowd] of Israel, so they will belong to the LORD.

18.verse: Afterward he will go out to the altar that is before the LORD and ·will make it ready for service to the LORD [make atonement for it]. Aaron will take some of the bull’s blood and some of the goat’s blood and put it on the ·corners [horns; Ex. 27:2] of the altar on all sides.

19.verse: Then, with his finger, he will sprinkle some of the blood on the altar seven times to make the altar holy for the LORD and clean from all the sins of the Israelites.

20.verse: “When Aaron has finished making ·the Most Holy Place, the Meeting Tent, and the altar ready for service to the LORD [atonement for the Most Holy Place, the Meeting Tent, and the altar], he will offer the living goat.

21.verse: He will ·put [lay] both his hands on the head of the living goat [a sign of association of the offerer and the animal], and he will confess over it all the sins and crimes of Israel. In this way Aaron will put the people’s sins on the goat’s head. Then he will send the goat away into the ·desert [wilderness], and a man who has been appointed will lead the goat away.

22.verse: So the goat will carry on itself all the people’s sins to a lonely place in the desert. The man who leads the goat will let it loose there.

23.verse: “Then Aaron will enter the Meeting Tent and take off the linen clothes he had put on before he went into the Most Holy Place; he must leave these clothes there.

24.verse: He will bathe his body in water in a holy place and put on his regular clothes [his more ornate priestly clothes]. Then he will come out and offer the whole burnt offering [1:1–17] for himself and for the people, to ·remove sins from himself and the people so they will belong to the LORD [make atonement for himself and the people].

25.verse: Then he will burn the fat of the sin offering on the altar.

26.verse: “The person who led the goat, ·the goat to remove sins [the scapegoat; for/to Azazel; 16:8], into the desert must wash his clothes and bathe his body in water. After that, he may come back into the camp.

27.verse: “The bull and the goat for the ·sin [or purification; 4:3] offerings, whose blood was brought into the Most Holy Place to make ·it ready for service to the LORD [atonement], must be taken outside the camp; the animals’ skins, bodies, and intestines will be burned in the fire.

28.verse: Then the one who burns them must wash his clothes and bathe his body in water. After that, he may come back into the camp.

29.verse: “This ·law [statute; ordinance; requirement] will always continue for you: On the tenth day of the seventh month, you must deny yourself [perhaps a reference to fasting] and you must not do any work. The ·travelers [or citizens] or ·foreigners living with you [alien residents] must not work either.

30.verse: It is on this day that the priests will make you clean ·so you will belong to the LORD again [and make atonement for you]. All your sins will be removed.

31.verse: This is a very important day of rest for you, and you must deny yourselves. This ·law [statute; ordinance; regulation] will continue forever.

32.verse: “The priest ·appointed to take his father’s place, on whom the oil was poured [who is anointed and consecrated in his father’s place], will ·perform the acts for making things ready for service to the LORD [make atonement]. He must put on the holy linen clothes

33.verse: and make ·the Most Holy Place, the Meeting Tent, and the altar ready for service to the LORD [atonement for the Most Holy Place, the Meeting Tent, and the altar]. He must ·also remove the sins of the priests and all the people of Israel so they will belong to the LORD [make atonement for the priests and the people of Israel].

34.verse: That ·law [statute; ordinance; requirement] for removing the sins of the Israelites ·so they will belong to the LORD [and make atonement] will continue forever. You will do these things once a year.” So they did the things the LORD had commanded Moses.

1.verse: Offering Sacrifices - The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “Speak to Aaron, his sons, and all the ·people [sons; children] of Israel. Tell them: ‘This is what the LORD has commanded.

3.verse: If ·an Israelite [a person from the house of Israel] ·kills [slaughters] an ox, a lamb, or a goat either inside the camp or outside it,

4.verse: when he should have brought the animal to the entrance of the Meeting Tent as a ·gift [offering] to the LORD in front of the LORD’s ·Holy Tent [sanctuary], he is guilty of ·killing [shedding blood]. He has ·killed [shed blood], and he must be cut off from the people.

5.verse: This rule is so ·people [the sons/children of Israel] will bring their sacrifices, which they have been sacrificing in the open fields, to the LORD. They must bring those animals to the LORD at the entrance of the Meeting Tent; they must bring them to the priest and offer them as ·fellowship [or peace; well-being] offerings [3:1].

6.verse: Then the priest will ·sprinkle [dash] the blood from those animals on the LORD’s altar near the entrance of the Meeting Tent. And he will ·burn [turn into smoke] the fat from those animals on the altar [3:17], as a smell pleasing to the LORD.

7.verse: They must not offer any more sacrifices to their goat idols [goat images representing demons; 2 Chr. 11:15; Is. 13:21; 34:14], which they have chased like prostitutes [spiritual infidelity is often likened to marital infidelity; Hos. 1:2]. These ·rules [statutes; ordinances; requirements] will continue for people ·from now on [throughout their generations].’

8.verse: “Tell the people this: ‘If ·any citizen [anyone from the house] of Israel or ·foreigner living with you [sojourner; wanderer; resident alien] offers a burnt offering [1:1–17] or sacrifice,

9.verse: that person must take his sacrifice to the entrance of the Meeting Tent to offer it to the LORD. If he does not do this, he must be cut off from the people.

10.verse: “‘I will be against ·any citizen [anyone from the house] of Israel or ·foreigner living with you [sojourner; wanderer; resident alien] who eats blood [3:17]. I will cut off that person from the people.

11.verse: This is because the life of the body is in the blood, and I have given you rules for pouring that blood on the altar ·to remove your sins so you will belong to the LORD [to make atonement]. It is the blood that ·removes the sins [makes atonement], because it is life.

12.verse: So I tell the ·people [sons; children] of Israel this: “None of you may eat blood, and no ·foreigner living among you [resident alien] may eat blood.”

13.verse: “‘If any ·citizen [of the sons/children] of Israel or ·foreigner living among you [resident alien] ·catches [hunts] a wild animal or bird that can be eaten, that person must pour the blood on the ground and cover it with dirt.

14.verse: If blood is still in the ·meat [flesh], the animal’s life is still in it. So I give this command to the ·people [sons; children] of Israel: “Don’t eat ·meat [flesh] that still has blood in it, because the animal’s life is in its blood. Anyone who eats blood must be cut off [3:17].”

15.verse: “‘If a person, either a ·citizen [native] or a ·foreigner [resident alien], eats an animal that died by itself or was killed by another animal, he must wash his clothes and bathe in water. He will be unclean [in a ritual sense] until evening; then he will be clean.

16.verse: If he does not wash his clothes and bathe his body, he will ·be guilty of sin [carry their guilt].’”

1.verse: Rules About Sexual Relations - The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “Tell the ·people [sons; children] of Israel: ‘I am the LORD your God.

3.verse: In the past you lived in Egypt, but you must not do what was done in that country. And you must not do as they do in the land of Canaan, where I am bringing you. Do not follow their ·customs [statutes; ordinances; requirements].

4.verse: You must obey my ·rules [regulations] and ·follow [guard; keep] ·them [my statutes/ordinances/requirements]. I am the LORD your God.

5.verse: ·Obey [Guard; Keep] my ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and ·rules [regulations]; a person who obeys them will live because of them. I am the LORD.

6.verse: “‘You must never ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] your close relatives. I am the LORD.

7.verse: “‘You must not ·shame [expose/uncover the nakedness of] your father by ·having sexual relations with [exposing/uncovering the nakedness of] your mother. She is your mother; do not ·have sexual relations with her [expose/uncover her nakedness].

8.verse: You must not ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] your father’s wife; ·that would shame [it is the nakedness of] your father.

9.verse: “‘You must not ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] your sister, either the daughter of your father or your mother. It doesn’t matter if she was born in your house or somewhere else.

10.verse: “‘You must not ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] your son’s daughter or your daughter’s daughter; ·that would bring shame on you [their nakedness is your nakedness].

11.verse: “‘If your father and his wife have a daughter, she is your sister. You must not ·have sexual relations with her [expose/uncover her nakedness].

12.verse: “‘You must not ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] your father’s sister; she is your father’s close relative.

13.verse: You must not ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] your mother’s sister; she is your mother’s close relative.

14.verse: You must not ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] the wife of your father’s brother, ·because this would shame him [you should not approach his wife]. She is your aunt.

15.verse: “‘You must not ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] your daughter-in-law; she is your son’s wife. ·Do not have sexual relations with her [You must not expose/uncover her nakedness].

16.verse: “‘You must not ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] your brother’s wife. ·That would shame [It is the nakedness of] your brother.

17.verse: “‘You must not ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] both a woman and her daughter. And do not ·have sexual relations with [expose/uncover the nakedness of] this woman’s granddaughter, either the daughter of her son or her daughter; they are her close relatives. It is evil to do this.

18.verse: “‘While your wife is still living, you must not take her sister as ·another wife [a rival]. Do not ·have sexual relations with her [expose/uncover her nakedness].

19.verse: “‘You must not go near a woman to ·have sexual relations with her [expose/uncover her nakedness] during her monthly period, when she is unclean [in a ritual sense; 15:19–33].

20.verse: “‘You must not have ·sexual relations [intercourse] with your neighbor’s wife and make yourself unclean with her.

21.verse: “‘You must not give any of your children to ·be sacrificed [pass them over; an allusion to passing them through fire] to Molech [probably an Ammonite god; 20:3–5; 2 Kin. 23:10; Jer. 32:35], ·because this would show that you do not respect [and so profane the name of] your God. I am the LORD.

22.verse: “‘You must not ·have sexual relations [lie] with a man as you would a woman. That is ·a hateful sin [an abomination].

23.verse: “‘You must not have ·sexual relations [intercourse] with an animal and make yourself unclean with it. Also a woman must not ·have sexual relations with an animal [stand in front of an animal for copulation]; it is ·not natural [perverted].

24.verse: “‘Don’t make yourself unclean by any of these wrong things. I am forcing nations out of their countries because they did these sins, and I am giving their land to you.

25.verse: The land has become unclean [in a ritual sense], and I punished it for its sins, so the land is ·throwing [vomiting] out those people who live there.

26.verse: “‘You must ·obey [guard; keep] my ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and ·rules [regulations], and you must not do any of these ·hateful sins [abominations]. ·These rules [They] are for ·the citizens of Israel and for the people who live with you [natives and resident aliens].

27.verse: The people who lived in the land before you did all these ·hateful [abominable] things and made the land unclean.

28.verse: If you do these things, you will also make the land unclean, and it will ·throw [vomit] you out as it ·threw [vomited] out the nations before you.

29.verse: Anyone who does these ·hateful sins [abominations] must be cut off from the people.

30.verse: ·Keep [Guard] my command not to do these ·hateful sins [abominations] that were done by the people who lived in the land before you. Don’t make yourself unclean by doing them. I am the LORD your God.’”

1.verse: Other Laws - The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “Tell all the ·people [congregation/community of the sons/children] of Israel: ‘I am the LORD your God. You must be holy because I am holy.

3.verse: “‘You must ·respect [fear; revere] your mother and father [Ex. 20:12; Deut. 5:16], and you must keep my Sabbaths [Ex. 20:8–11; Deut. 5:12–15]. I am the LORD your God.

4.verse: “‘Do not ·worship [turn to] idols or make ·statues of gods [cast images] for yourselves [Ex. 20:4–6; Deut. 5:8–10]. I am the LORD your God.

5.verse: “‘When you sacrifice a ·fellowship [or peace; well-being] offering [3:1] to the LORD, offer it in such a way that will be accepted.

6.verse: You may eat it the same day you offer it or on the next day. But if any is left on the third day, you must burn it ·up [with fire].

7.verse: If any of it is eaten on the third day, it is unclean, and it will not be accepted.

8.verse: Anyone who eats it then will ·be guilty of sin [bear iniquity], because he ·did not respect [profaned] the holy things that belong to the LORD. He must be cut off from the people.

9.verse: “‘When you harvest your crops on your land, do not harvest all the way to the corners of your fields. If grain falls onto the ground, don’t gather it up.

10.verse: Don’t pick all the grapes in your vineyards, and don’t pick up the grapes that fall to the ground. You must leave those things for poor people and for ·people traveling through your country [resident aliens; Deut. 24:19–22; Ruth 2]. I am the LORD your God.

11.verse: “‘You must not steal [Ex. 20:15; Deut. 5:19]. You must not cheat people, and you must not lie to each other [Ex. 20:16; Deut. 5:20].

12.verse: You must not make a false promise by my name, or you will ·show that you don’t respect [profane the name of] your God. I am the LORD.

13.verse: “‘You must not ·cheat [oppress] your neighbor or rob him. You must not keep a hired worker’s salary all night until morning [Deut. 24:14–15; Jer. 22:13].

14.verse: You must not ·curse [or belittle] a deaf person or put ·something [a stumbling block] in front of a blind person to make him fall [Deut. 27:18]. But you must ·respect [fear; Prov. 1:7] your God. I am the LORD.

15.verse: “‘·Be fair in your judging [Do not render perverted judgment]. You must not show ·special favor [partiality] to poor people or great people, but ·be fair when you [with righteousness] judge your ·neighbor [countryman; James 2:1, 9].

16.verse: You must not spread ·false stories [slander] against other people, and you must not do anything that would ·put your neighbor’s life in danger [stand against the blood of your neighbor]. I am the LORD.

17.verse: “‘You must not hate your ·fellow citizen [brother] in your heart. ·If your ·neighbor [countryman] does something wrong, tell him about it [You must reprove your brother], or you will be partly to blame.

18.verse: ·Forget about the wrong things people do to you, and do not try to get even [You should not seek revenge or bear a grudge against any of your people]. Love your neighbor as you love yourself [Matt. 19:19; 22:39; Mark 12:31, 33; Luke 10:27]. I am the LORD.

19.verse: “‘·Obey [Keep; Guard] my ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements]. You must not ·mate [breed] two different kinds of ·cattle [animals] or sow your field with two different kinds of seed. You must not wear clothing made from two different kinds of material mixed together.

20.verse: “‘If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with a slave girl ·of [betrothed to] another man, but this slave girl has not been ·bought [ransomed] or given her freedom, there must be ·punishment [an inquiry]. But they are not to be put to death, because the woman was not free.

21.verse: The man must bring a ·male sheep [ram] as his ·penalty [guilt; reparation; 5:14–6:7] offering to the LORD at the entrance to the Meeting Tent.

22.verse: The priest will offer the ·sheep [ram] as a ·penalty [guilt; reparation; 5:14–6:7] offering before the LORD for the man’s sin, ·to remove the sins of the man so he will belong to the LORD […and make atonement for him]. Then he will be forgiven for his sin.

23.verse: “‘In the future, when you enter your country, you will plant many kinds of trees for food. ·After planting a tree, wait three years before using its fruit [You should regard its fruit as uncircumcised for three years; do not eat it].

24.verse: In the fourth year the fruit from the tree will be the LORD’s, a holy offering of praise to him.

25.verse: Then in the fifth year, you may eat the fruit from the tree. The tree will then produce more fruit for you. I am the LORD your God.

26.verse: “‘You must not eat anything with the blood in it [3:17]. “‘You must not try to tell the future by signs or ·black magic [divination; Deut. 18:9–12].

27.verse: “‘You must not cut the hair on ·the sides of your heads [your temples] or cut the edges of your beard.

28.verse: You must not cut your body for the dead [a pagan sign of mourning; Deut. 14:1; Jer. 16:6; 41:5] or put tattoo marks on yourselves. I am the LORD.

29.verse: “‘Do not ·dishonor [profane] your daughter by making her become a prostitute. If you do this, the country will be ·filled [prostituted] with all kinds of sin.

30.verse: “‘·Obey [Keep; Guard] ·the laws about Sabbaths [my Sabbaths], and ·respect [reverence] my ·Most Holy Place [sanctuary]. I am the LORD.

31.verse: “‘Do not ·go [turn] to mediums or ·fortune-tellers [wizards] ·for advice [and do not seek them], or you will become unclean [in a ritual sense]. I am the LORD your God.

32.verse: “‘Show respect to old people; stand up in their presence [Prov. 16:31; 20:29]. ·Show respect also to [Fear] your God. I am the LORD.

33.verse: “‘Do not mistreat ·foreigners living [resident aliens] in your country,

34.verse: but treat them just as you treat your own ·citizens [natives]. Love ·foreigners [resident aliens] as you love yourselves, because you were ·foreigners [sojourners; wanderers; resident aliens; Ex. 22:21; Jer. 22:3] one time in Egypt. I am the LORD your God.

35.verse: “‘Do not ·cheat [do injustice] when you measure the length or weight or ·amount of something [quantity; capacity; Deut. 25:13–16; Prov. 11:1; Ezek. 45:10–12].

36.verse: Your weights and balances should weigh ·correctly [honestly], with your weighing baskets the right size and your jars holding the right amount of liquid. I am the LORD your God. I brought you out of the land of Egypt.

37.verse: “‘·Remember [Keep; Guard] all my ·laws [statutes; regulations; requirements] and ·rules [regulations], and obey them. I am the LORD.’”

1.verse: Warnings About Various Sins - The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “You must also tell the ·people [sons; children] of Israel these things: ‘If a person in your country gives one of his children to Molech [18:21], that person must be ·killed [put to death]. It doesn’t matter if he is a ·citizen [son of Israel] or a ·foreigner living [resident alien sojourning] in Israel; you must ·throw stones at [stone] him and ·kill him [put him to death].

3.verse: I will be against him and cut him off from his people, because he gave his children to Molech. He showed that he ·did not respect [profaned] my holy name, and he made my ·Holy Place [sanctuary] unclean.

4.verse: The people of the ·community [land] might ·ignore [close their eyes to; or connive with] that person and not kill the one who gave his children to Molech.

5.verse: But I will ·be [set my face] against him and his family, and I will cut him off from his people. I will do this to anyone who follows him in ·being unfaithful to me [prostituting himself] by worshiping Molech.

6.verse: “‘I will ·be [set my face] against anyone who ·goes [turns] to mediums and ·fortune-tellers [wizards] for advice, because that person is ·being unfaithful to [prostituting himself against] me. So I will cut him off from his people.

7.verse: “‘Be my holy people. Be holy because I am the LORD your God.

8.verse: ·Remember [Keep; Guard] and obey my ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements]. I am the LORD, and I have ·made you holy [consecrated you].

9.verse: “‘Anyone who curses his father or mother must be put to death. He has cursed his father or mother, so he has brought his own ·death [blood] on himself [Ex. 20:12; Deut. 5:16].

10.verse: Punishments for Sexual Sins - “‘If a man ·has sexual relations [commits adultery] with his neighbor’s wife, both the ·man and the woman are guilty of adultery and [adulterer and the adulteress] must be put to death [18:20; Deut. 22:22].

11.verse: If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with his father’s wife, ·he has shamed [exposing/revealing the nakedness of] his father, and both the man and his father’s wife must be put to death. They have brought ·it [blood] on themselves [18:8; Deut. 22:30].

12.verse: “‘If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with his daughter-in-law, both of them must be put to death. What they have done is ·not natural [perverted]. They have brought ·their own deaths [blood] on themselves.

13.verse: “‘If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with another man as a man does with a woman, these two men have ·done a hateful sin [committed an abomination]. They must be put to death. They have brought ·it [blood] on themselves [18:22].

14.verse: “‘If a man ·has sexual relations with [or marries; takes] both a woman and her mother, this is ·evil [lewd; depraved]. The people must burn that man and the two women in fire so that your people will not be ·evil [lewd; depraved].

15.verse: “‘If a man has sexual relations with an animal, he must be put to death. You must also kill the animal.

16.verse: If a woman approaches an animal and has sexual relations with it, you must kill the woman and the animal. They must be put to death. They have brought ·it [blood] on themselves [18:23; Ex. 22:19; Deut. 27:21].

17.verse: “‘It is shameful for a brother to ·marry [take] his sister, the daughter of either his father or his mother, and ·to have sexual relations with her [he sees her nakedness, and she sees his nakedness]. In front of everyone they must both be cut off from their people. The man has ·shamed [exposed/revealed the nakedness of] his sister, and he is guilty of sin [18:9].

18.verse: “‘If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with a woman during her monthly period, both the woman and the man must be cut off from their people. They sinned because ·they showed the source of her blood [he uncovered her fountain and she has revealed the fountain of her blood; 18:19].

19.verse: “‘Do not ·have sexual relations with [uncover the nakedness of] your mother’s sister or your father’s sister, because that would ·shame a close relative [expose one’s own flesh]. Both of you are guilty of this sin [18:12–13].

20.verse: “‘If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with his uncle’s wife, he has ·shamed [exposed/revealed the nakedness of] his uncle. That man and his uncle’s wife will die without children; they are guilty of sin.

21.verse: “‘It is unclean [in a ritual sense] for a man to ·marry [take] his brother’s wife. That man has ·shamed [exposed/revealed the nakedness of] his brother, and they will have no children [18:16].

22.verse: “‘·Remember [Keep; Guard] all my ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and ·rules [regulations], and obey them. I am leading you to your own land, and if you obey my laws and rules, that land will not ·throw [vomit] you out.

23.verse: I am ·forcing [driving] out ahead of you the people who live there. Because they did all these sins, I have hated them. Do not live ·the way those people lived [according to the statutes/ordinances/requirements of that nation].

24.verse: “‘I have told you that you will ·get [inherit] their land, which I will give to you as your ·very own [possession]; it is a ·fertile land [land flowing with milk and honey; Ex. 3:8]. I am the LORD your God, and I have set you apart from other people and made you my own.

25.verse: So you must treat clean [in a ritual sense] animals and birds differently from unclean animals and birds. Do not make yourselves detestable by any of these unclean birds or animals or things that crawl on the ground, which I have made unclean for you [11:1–47].

26.verse: So you must be holy to me because I, the LORD, am holy, and I have set you apart from other people to be my own.

27.verse: “‘A man or woman who is a medium or a ·fortune-teller [wizard] must be put to death. You must stone them to death; they have brought ·it [blood] on themselves [19:31; 20:6].’”

1.verse: How Priests Must Behave - The LORD said to Moses, “Tell these things to Aaron’s sons, the priests: ‘A priest must not make himself unclean [in a ritual sense] ·by touching a dead person [for a death among his people/relatives].

2.verse: ·But if the dead person was one of his close relatives, he may touch him […except for a close relative]. The priest may make himself unclean if the dead person is his mother or father, son or daughter, brother or

3.verse: ·unmarried [virgin] sister who is close to him because she has no husband. The priest may make himself unclean for her if she dies.

4.verse: But a priest must not make himself unclean ·if the dead person was only related to him by marriage [as a husband among his people].

5.verse: “‘Priests must not shave their heads, or shave off the edges of their beards, or cut their bodies [as pagan priests often did].

6.verse: They must be holy to their God and ·show respect for [not defile] God’s name, because they present the offerings made by fire to the LORD, which is the food of their God. So they must be holy [19:27–28].

7.verse: “‘A priest must not marry ·a defiled prostitute [or a prostitute or a defiled woman] or a divorced woman, because he is holy to his God.

8.verse: Treat him as holy, because he offers up the food of your God. Think of him as holy; I am the LORD who ·makes you holy [consecrates/sanctifies you], and I am holy.

9.verse: “‘If a priest’s daughter defiles herself by becoming a prostitute, she ·shames [defiles] her father. She must be burned with fire.

10.verse: “‘The high priest, who was ·chosen from among his brothers [exalted among his brothers], had the ·special [anointing] olive oil poured on his head. He was also ·appointed [consecrated] to wear the priestly clothes. So he must not let his hair go uncombed or tear his clothes [signs of mourning].

11.verse: He must not go into a house where there is a dead body. He must not make himself unclean [in a ritual sense], even if it is for his own father or mother.

12.verse: The high priest must not go out of the ·Holy Place [sanctuary], because if he does and becomes ·unclean [defiled], he will make God’s ·Holy Place [sanctuary] unclean. The ·special oil used in appointing priests [anointing oil] was poured on his head to separate him from the rest of the people. I am the LORD.

13.verse: “‘The high priest must marry a woman who is a virgin.

14.verse: He must not marry a widow, a divorced woman, or ·a defiled prostitute [or a defiled woman or a prostitute; v. 7]. He must marry a virgin from his own people

15.verse: so ·the people will respect his children as his own [he will not defile his children]. I am the LORD. I have ·set the high priest apart for his special job [sanctified/consecrated him].’”

16.verse: The LORD said to Moses,

17.verse: “Tell Aaron: ‘If any of your descendants have ·something wrong with them [a blemish], they must never come near to offer the special food of their God.

18.verse: Anyone who has ·something wrong with him [a blemish] must not come near: blind men, crippled men, men with damaged faces, deformed men,

19.verse: men with a crippled foot or hand,

20.verse: hunchbacks, dwarfs, men who have something wrong with their eyes, men who have an itching disease or a skin disease, or men who ·have damaged testicles [are eunuchs; Acts 8:27].

21.verse: “‘If one of Aaron’s descendants has ·something wrong with him [a blemish], he cannot come near to make the offerings made by fire to the LORD. He has ·something wrong with him [a blemish]; he cannot offer the food of his God.

22.verse: He may eat the most holy food and also the holy food.

23.verse: But he may not go through the curtain into the ·Most Holy Place [sanctuary], and he may not go near the altar, because he has ·something wrong with him [a blemish]. He must not defile my ·Holy Place [sanctuary]. I am the LORD who makes these places holy.’”

24.verse: So Moses told these things to Aaron, Aaron’s sons, and all the people of Israel.

1.verse: The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “Tell Aaron and his sons: ‘The ·people [sons; children] of Israel will give offerings to me. These offerings are ·holy, and they are mine [consecrated/sanctified to me], so you must ·respect [be scrupulous with] them to show that you ·respect [do not defile] my holy name. I am the LORD.’

3.verse: Say to them: ‘If any one of your descendants ·from now on [throughout your generations] is unclean [in a ritual sense] and comes near the offerings that the Israelites ·made holy for [consecrated/sanctified to] me, that person must be cut off from appearing before me. I am the LORD.

4.verse: “‘If one of Aaron’s descendants has a harmful skin disease [13:2], or if he discharges a body fluid [15:1–18], he cannot eat the holy offerings until he becomes clean [in a ritual sense]. He could also become unclean from touching a dead body, from his own semen,

5.verse: from touching any unclean crawling animal, or from touching an unclean person (no matter what made the person unclean).

6.verse: Anyone who touches those things will become unclean until evening. That person must not eat the holy offerings unless he washes with water.

7.verse: He will be clean only after the sun goes down. Then he may eat the holy offerings; the offerings are his food.

8.verse: “‘If a priest finds an animal that died by itself or that was killed by some other animal, he must not eat it. If he does, he will become unclean [in a ritual sense]. I am the LORD [11:39–40; 17:15].

9.verse: “‘If the priests ·keep [guard] all the rules I have given, they will not become guilty; ·if they are careful, they will not die [or…and die in it/the sanctuary because they defiled it]. I am the LORD who has made them holy.

10.verse: ·Only people in a priest’s family [No stranger/layperson] may eat the holy offering. A visitor staying with the priest or a hired worker must not eat it.

11.verse: But if the priest buys a slave with his own money, that slave may eat the holy offerings; ·slaves [those] who were born in his house may also eat his food.

12.verse: If a priest’s daughter marries a ·person who is not a priest [layperson; stranger], she must not eat any of the holy offerings.

13.verse: But if the priest’s daughter becomes widowed or divorced, with no children to support her, and if she goes back to her father’s house where she lived as a child, she may eat some of her father’s food. But ·only people from a priest’s family [no layperson/stranger] may eat this food.

14.verse: “‘If someone eats some of the holy offering by mistake, that person must pay back the priest for that holy food, adding another one-fifth of the price of that food.

15.verse: “‘When the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel] give their holy offerings to the LORD, ·the priest must not treat these holy things as though they were not holy [no one will profane them].

16.verse: The priests must not allow those who are not priests to eat the holy offerings. If they do, they cause the ones who eat the holy offerings to become guilty, and they will have to ·pay for it [offer a penalty/guilt/reparation offering; 5:14–6:7]. I am the LORD, who makes them holy.’”

17.verse: The LORD said to Moses,

18.verse: “Tell Aaron and his sons and all the people of Israel: ‘A ·citizen of [person from the house of] Israel or a ·foreigner living [sojourner; wanderer; resident alien] in Israel might want to bring a whole burnt offering [1:1–17], either for ·some special promise he has made [a vow] or for a ·special gift he wants to give [freewill offering] to the LORD.

19.verse: If he does, he must bring a male animal that has ·nothing wrong with it [no blemish]—a bull, a sheep, or a goat—so it might be accepted for him.

20.verse: He must not bring an animal that has ·something wrong with it [a blemish], or it will not be accepted for him.

21.verse: “‘If someone brings a ·fellowship [or peace; well-being] offering [3:1] to the LORD, either as ·payment [fulfillment] for a ·special promise the person has made [vow] or as a ·special gift the person wants to give the LORD [freewill offering], it might be from the herd or from the flock. But it must be ·healthy [perfect], with ·nothing wrong with it [no blemish], so that it will be accepted.

22.verse: You must not offer to the LORD any animal that is blind, that has broken bones or is crippled, that has running sores or any sort of ·skin disease [itch or scabs]. You must not offer any animals like these on the altar as an offering by fire to the LORD.

23.verse: “‘If an ox or lamb ·is smaller than normal [or has a short tail] or is not perfectly formed, you may give it as a ·special gift to the LORD [freewill offering]; it will be accepted. But it will not be accepted as payment for a ·special promise you have made [vow].

24.verse: “‘If an animal has bruised, crushed, torn, or cut testicles, you must not offer it to the LORD. You must not do this in your own land,

25.verse: and you must not ·take [get] such animals from foreigners as sacrifices to the LORD. Because the animals have been hurt in some way and have ·something wrong with them [blemishes], they will not be accepted for you.’”

27.verse: “When an ox, a sheep, or a goat is born, it must stay seven days with its mother. But from the eighth day on, this animal will be accepted as a sacrifice by fire to the LORD.

28.verse: But you must not ·kill [slaughter] the animal and its mother on the same day, either an ox or a sheep.

29.verse: “If you want to offer ·some special offering of thanks [a thank offering] to the LORD, you must do it in a way that pleases him.

30.verse: You must eat the whole animal that same day and not leave any of the meat for the next morning. I am the LORD.

31.verse: “·Remember [Keep; Guard] my commands and obey them; I am the LORD.

32.verse: ·Show respect for [Do not defile] my holy name. ·You Israelites must remember that I am holy [I must be sanctified/considered holy among the sons/children of Israel]; I am the LORD, who has ·made you holy [consecrated/sanctified you].

33.verse: I brought you out of Egypt to be your God. I am the LORD.”

1.verse: Special Holidays - The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “Tell the ·people [sons; children] of Israel: ‘You will announce the LORD’s appointed ·feasts [festivals] as holy ·meetings [convocations]. These are my special ·feasts [festivals].

3.verse: The Sabbath - “‘There are six days for you to work, but the seventh day will be a special day of rest. It is a day for a holy ·meeting [convocation]; you must not do any work. It is a Sabbath to the LORD in all your homes [Ex. 20:8–11; 31:12–17; 35:1–3; Num. 28:9–10; Deut. 5:12–15].

4.verse: The Passover and Unleavened Bread - “‘These are the LORD’s appointed ·feasts [festivals], the holy ·meetings [convocations], which you will announce at the times set for them.

5.verse: The LORD’s Passover is on the fourteenth day of the first month, beginning at twilight.

6.verse: The ·Feast [Festival] of Unleavened Bread begins on the fifteenth day of the same month. You will eat bread made without ·yeast [leaven] for seven days.

7.verse: On the first day of this ·feast [festival] you will have a holy ·meeting [convocation], and you must not do any work.

8.verse: For seven days you will bring an offering made by fire to the LORD. There will be a holy ·meeting [convocation] on the seventh day, and on that day you must not do any regular work [Ex. 12:1–13, 21–27; 23:15; Num. 28:16–25; Deut. 16:1–8].’”

9.verse: The First of the Harvest - The LORD said to Moses,

10.verse: “Tell the ·people [sons; children] of Israel: ‘You will enter the land I will give you and gather its harvest. At that time you must bring the first bundle of grain from your harvest to the priest.

11.verse: The priest will ·present [wave] the bundle before the LORD, and it will be accepted for you; he will ·present [wave] the bundle on the day after the Sabbath.

12.verse: “‘On the day when you ·present [wave; 23:15] the bundle of grain, offer a male lamb, one year old, that ·has nothing wrong with it [is perfect], as a burnt offering [1:1–17] to the LORD.

13.verse: You must also offer a ·grain [gift; tribute] offering [2:1]—·four quarts [two tenths of an ephah] of ·fine [choice] flour mixed with olive oil as an offering made by fire to the LORD; its smell will be pleasing to him. You must also offer ·a quart [one-fourth of a hin] of wine as a drink offering.

14.verse: Until the day you bring your offering to your God, do not eat any new grain, roasted grain, or bread made from new grain. This ·law [statute; ordinance; requirement] will always continue ·for people from now on [throughout your generations], wherever you live [Ex. 23:16; Num. 28:26–31; Deut. 16:9–12].

15.verse: The Feast of Weeks - “‘Count seven full weeks from the morning after the Sabbath. (This is the Sabbath that you bring the bundle of grain to ·present [wave] as an offering [a ritual whereby the offerer symbolically waves the offering before God but then uses it].)

16.verse: On the fiftieth day, the first day after the seventh week, you will bring a new grain offering to the LORD.

17.verse: On that day bring two loaves of bread from your homes to be ·presented [waved] as an offering. Use yeast and ·four quarts [two-tenths of an ephah] of flour to make those loaves of bread; they will be your gift to the LORD from the first wheat of your harvest.

18.verse: “‘Offer with the bread one young bull, two male sheep, and seven male lambs that are one year old and have ·nothing wrong with them [no blemish]. Offer them with their ·grain [gift; tribute] offerings [2:1] and drink offerings, as a burnt offering [1:1–17] to the LORD. They will be an offering made by fire, and the smell will be pleasing to the LORD.

19.verse: You must also offer one male goat for a ·sin [or purification; 4:3] offering and two male, one-year-old lambs as a ·fellowship [or peace; well-being] offering [3:1].

20.verse: “‘The priest will ·present [wave; 23:15] the two lambs as an offering before the LORD, along with the bread from the first wheat of the harvest. They are holy to the LORD, and they will belong to the priest.

21.verse: On that same day you will call a holy ·meeting [convocation]; you must not do any work that day. This ·law [statute; ordinance; requirement] will continue for you ·from now on [throughout your generations], wherever you live.

22.verse: “‘When you harvest your crops on your land, do not harvest all the way to the corners of your field. If grain falls onto the ground, don’t gather it up. Leave it for poor people and ·foreigners in your country [resident aliens; 19:9–10; Deut. 24:19–22; Ruth 2]. I am the LORD your God.’”

23.verse: The Feast of Trumpets - Again the LORD said to Moses,

24.verse: “Tell the ·people [sons] of Israel: ‘On the first day of the seventh month you must have a special day of rest, a holy ·meeting [convocation], when you blow the trumpet for a special time of remembering.

25.verse: Do not do any work, and bring an offering made by fire to the LORD [Num. 29:1–6].’”

26.verse: The Day of Cleansing - The LORD said to Moses,

27.verse: “The Day of ·Cleansing [Atonement] will be on the tenth day of the seventh month. There will be a holy ·meeting [convocation], and you will deny yourselves and bring an offering made by fire to the LORD.

28.verse: Do not do any work on that day, because it is the Day of ·Cleansing [Atonement]. On that day the priests will go before the LORD and ·perform the acts to make you clean from sin so you will belong to the LORD [make atonement for you].

29.verse: “Anyone who ·refuses to give up food [or does not deny himself] on this day must be cut off from the people.

30.verse: If anyone works on this day, I will destroy that person from among the people.

31.verse: You must not do any work at all; this ·law [statute; ordinance; requirement] will continue ·for people from now on [throughout your generations] wherever you live.

32.verse: It will be a special day of rest for you, and you must ·deny yourselves [or fast]. You will start this special day of rest on the evening after the ninth day of the month, and it will continue from that evening until the next evening [ch. 16; Num. 9:7–11].”

33.verse: The Feast of Shelters - Again the LORD said to Moses,

34.verse: “Tell the ·people [sons; children] of Israel: ‘On the fifteenth day of the seventh month is the ·Feast [Festival] of ·Shelters [Booths]. This ·feast [festival] to the LORD will continue for seven days.

35.verse: There will be a holy ·meeting [convocation] on the first day; do not do any work.

36.verse: You will bring an offering made by fire to the LORD each day for seven days. On the eighth day you will have another holy ·meeting [convocation], and you will bring an offering made by fire to the LORD. This will be a holy ·meeting [convocation]; do not do any work.

37.verse: (“‘These are the LORD’s special ·feasts [festivals], when there will be holy ·meetings [convocations] and when you bring offerings made by fire to the LORD. You will bring whole burnt offerings [1:1–17], ·grain [gift; tribute] offerings [2:1], sacrifices, and drink offerings—each at the right time.

38.verse: These offerings are in addition to those for the LORD’s Sabbath days, in addition to offerings you give as payment for ·special promises [vows], and in addition to ·special offerings you want to give to the LORD [freewill offerings].)

39.verse: “‘So on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, after you have gathered in the crops of the land, celebrate the LORD’s ·festival [feast] for seven days. You must rest on the first day and the eighth day.

40.verse: On the first day you will take good fruit from the fruit trees, as well as branches from palm trees, poplars, and other leafy trees. You will celebrate before the LORD your God for seven days.

41.verse: Celebrate this ·festival [feast] to the LORD for seven days each year. This ·law [statute; ordinance; requirement] will continue ·from now on [throughout your generations]; you will celebrate it in the seventh month.

42.verse: Live in ·shelters [booths] for seven days. All the people born in Israel must live in ·shelters [booths]

43.verse: so that all your descendants will know I made Israel live in ·shelters [booths] during the time I brought them out of Egypt. I am the LORD your God [Ex. 23:16–17; Num. 29:12–39; Deut. 16:13–15; 31:9–13].’”

44.verse: So Moses told the people of Israel about all of the LORD’s appointed ·feast [festival] days.

1.verse: The Lampstand and the Holy Bread - The LORD said to Moses,

2.verse: “Command the ·people [sons; children] of Israel to bring you pure oil from crushed olives. That oil is for the lamps so that these lamps may never go out.

3.verse: Aaron will keep the lamps burning in the Meeting Tent from evening until morning before the LORD; this is ·in front of [outside] the curtain of the ·Ark of the Agreement [Covenant; Treaty; Testimony]. This ·law [statute; ordinance; regulation] will continue ·from now on [throughout your generations].

4.verse: Aaron must always keep the lamps burning on the ·lampstand of pure gold [pure lampstand/Menorah; Ex. 25:31–40] before the LORD.

5.verse: “Take ·fine [choice] flour and bake twelve loaves of bread with it, using ·four quarts [two-tenths of an ephah] of flour for each loaf.

6.verse: Put them in two rows on the ·golden [pure] table [Ex. 25:23–30] before the LORD, six loaves in each row.

7.verse: Put pure incense on each row as the memorial portion to take the place of the bread. It is an offering made by fire to the LORD.

8.verse: Every Sabbath day Aaron will put the bread in order before the LORD, as an ·agreement [covenant; treaty] with the people of Israel that will continue forever.

9.verse: That bread will belong to Aaron and his sons. They will eat it in a holy place, because it is a most holy part of the offerings made by fire to the LORD. That bread is their share forever.”

10.verse: The Man Who Cursed God - Now there was a son of an Israelite woman and an Egyptian father who ·was walking [came out] among the Israelites. A fight broke out in the camp between him and an Israelite.

11.verse: The son of the Israelite woman began cursing and ·speaking against the LORD [blaspheming the name], so the people took him to Moses. (The mother’s name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri from the family of Dan.)

12.verse: The people ·held him as a prisoner [put him in custody] while they waited for the LORD’s ·command [decision; will] to be made clear to them.

13.verse: Then the LORD said to Moses,

14.verse: “Take the one who ·spoke against [cursed; blasphemed] me outside the camp. Then all the people who heard him must put their hands on his head, and all the ·people [community; assembly; congregation] must ·throw stones at him and kill [stone] him.

15.verse: Tell the ·people [sons; children] of Israel this: ‘If anyone curses his God, he is guilty of sin [Ex. 20:7; Deut. 5:11].

16.verse: Anyone who ·speaks against [curses/blasphemes the name of] the LORD must be put to death; all the ·people [community; assembly; congregation] must ·kill him by throwing stones at [stone] him. ·Foreigners [Sojourners; Wanderers; Resident aliens] must be punished just like ·the people born in Israel [natives]; if they ·speak against the LORD [curse/blaspheme the name], they must be put to death.

17.verse: “‘Whoever ·kills [strikes] another person must be put to death.

18.verse: Whoever ·kills [strikes] an animal that belongs to another person must give that person another animal to take its place.

19.verse: And whoever causes an injury to a ·neighbor [countryman] must receive the same kind of injury in return:

20.verse: Broken bone for broken bone, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. Anyone who injures another person must be injured in the same way in return [Ex. 21:24].

21.verse: Whoever ·kills [strikes] another person’s animal must give that person another animal to take its place. But whoever ·kills [strikes] another person must be put to death.

22.verse: “‘The ·law [regulation; standard] will be the same for the ·foreigner [sojouner; wanderer; resident alien] as for ·those from your own country [the native]. I am the LORD your God.’”

23.verse: Then Moses spoke to the ·people [sons; children] of Israel, and they took the person who had cursed outside the camp and ·killed him by throwing stones at [stoned] him. So the ·people [sons; children] of Israel did as the LORD had commanded Moses.

1.verse: The Time of Rest for the Land - The LORD said to Moses at Mount Sinai,

2.verse: “Tell the people of Israel this: ‘When you enter the land I will give you, let it have a ·special time of rest, to honor [sabbath to/for] the LORD.

3.verse: You may plant seed in your field for six years, and you may trim your vineyards for six years and bring in their fruits.

4.verse: But during the seventh year, you must let the land ·rest [have a sabbath]. This will be a ·special time to honor [sabbath to/for] the LORD. You must not plant seed in your field or ·trim [prune] your vineyards.

5.verse: You must not cut the crops that grow by themselves after harvest, or gather the grapes from your vines that are not ·trimmed [pruned]. The land will have a ·year of rest [sabbath].

6.verse: “‘You may eat whatever the land produces during that ·year of rest [sabbath]. It will be food for your men and women servants, for your hired workers, and for the ·foreigners living in your country [sojourners; wanderers; resident aliens].

7.verse: It will also be food for your cattle and the wild animals of your land. Whatever the land produces may be eaten.

8.verse: The Year of Jubilee - “‘Count off seven groups of seven years, [seven times seven years] or forty-nine years. During that time there will be seven ·years of rest [sabbatical years; 25:1–7] for the land.

9.verse: On the Day of ·Cleansing [Atonement; 16:1–34], you must blow the horn of a ·male sheep [ram]; this will be on the tenth day of the seventh month. You must blow the horn through the whole country.

10.verse: Make the fiftieth year a ·special [consecrated; holy] year, and announce ·freedom [liberty] for all the people living in your country. This time will be called Jubilee [a word related to the Hebrew for “ram’s horn”]. You will each go back to your own property, each to your own family and family group.

11.verse: The fiftieth year will be a special time for you to celebrate. Don’t plant seeds, or harvest the crops that grow by themselves, or gather grapes from the vines that are not ·trimmed [pruned].

12.verse: That year is Jubilee; it will be a holy time for you. You may eat only the crops that come from the field.

13.verse: In the year of Jubilee you each must go back to your own property.

14.verse: “‘If you sell your land to your ·neighbor [countryman], or if you buy land from your ·neighbor [countryman], don’t ·cheat [mistreat; exploit] each other.

15.verse: If you want to buy your ·neighbor’s [countryman’s] land, count the number of years since the last Jubilee, and use that number to decide the right price. If your ·neighbor [countryman] sells the land to you, count the number of years left for harvesting crops, and use that number to decide the right price.

16.verse: If there are many years, the price will be high. But if there are only a few years, lower the price, because your neighbor is really selling only a few crops to you.

17.verse: You must not ·cheat [mistreat; exploit] ·each other [your neighbor/countryman], but you must ·respect [fear] your God. I am the LORD your God.

18.verse: “‘·Remember [Observe] my ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and ·rules [regulations], and ·obey [keep; guard] them so that you will live ·safely [securely] in the land.

19.verse: The land will give ·good crops [its fruit] to you, and you will eat as much as you want and live ·safely [securely] in the land.

20.verse: “‘But you might ask, “If we don’t plant seeds or gather crops, what will we eat the seventh year?”

21.verse: I will ·send [command for] you such a great blessing during the sixth year that the land will produce enough crops for three years.

22.verse: When you plant in the eighth year, you will still be eating from the old crop; you will eat the old crop until the harvest of the ninth year.

23.verse: Property Laws - “‘The land really belongs to me, so you can’t sell it ·for all time [in perpetuity]. You are only ·foreigners [sojourners; wanderers; resident aliens] and ·travelers living for a while on my land [tenants with me].

24.verse: ·People might sell their land, but it must always be possible for the family to get its land back [Throughout all the land of your possession, you must allow for redemption of the land].

25.verse: If ·a person in your country [your brother/kinsman] becomes very poor and sells some land, then close relatives ·must [or can] come and ·buy it back [redeem what his brother/kinsman has sold].

26.verse: If there is not a ·close relative to buy the land back [redeemer], but if the person ·makes enough money to be able to buy it back [prospers and he is able to redeem it],

27.verse: the years must be ·counted [calculated] since the land was sold. That number must be used to decide how much the first owner should pay back the one who bought it. Then the land will belong to the first owner again.

28.verse: But if there is not enough money to buy it back, the one who bought it will keep it until the year of Jubilee. During that celebration, the land will go back to the first owner’s family.

29.verse: “‘If someone sells a home in a walled city, for a full year after it is sold, the person has the right to ·buy it back [redeem it].

30.verse: But if the owner does not ·buy back the house [redeem it] before a full year is over, it will belong to the one who bought it ·and to his future sons [in perpetuity, throughout his generations]. The house will not go back to the first owner at Jubilee.

31.verse: But houses in ·small towns [villages] without walls are like open ·country [fields]; they can be ·bought back [redeemed], and they must be returned to their first owner at Jubilee.

32.verse: “‘The Levites may always ·buy back [redeem] their houses in the cities that belong to them.

33.verse: If someone buys a house from a Levite, that house in the Levites’ city will again belong to the Levites in the Jubilee. This is because houses in Levite cities belong to the people of Levi; ·the Israelites gave these cities to them [for the houses of the cities of the Levites are their possession in the midst of the sons/children of Israel; Num. 35:1–8; Josh. 21:1–45].

34.verse: Also the ·fields and pastures [open land] around the Levites’ cities cannot be sold, because ·those fields belong to the Levites [that is their possession] forever.

35.verse: Rules for Slave Owners - “‘If ·anyone from your country [your brother/kinsman] becomes too poor ·to support himself [or and dependent on you], ·help [support] him to live among you as you would a ·stranger [sojourner/wanderer/resident alien] or ·foreigner [or tenant].

36.verse: Do not charge him any interest on money ·you loan to him [or try to make a profit; Ex. 22:25; Deut. 23:19–20], but ·respect [fear] your God; let ·the poor [your brother/kinsman] live among you.

37.verse: Don’t lend him money for interest, and don’t try to make a profit from the food he buys.

38.verse: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to give the land of Canaan to you and to become your God.

39.verse: “‘If ·anyone from your country [your brother/kinsman] becomes very poor and sells himself as a slave to you, you must not make him work like a slave [Ex. 21:2–6; Deut. 15:12–18].

40.verse: He will be like a hired worker and a ·visitor [or tenant] with you until the year of Jubilee.

41.verse: Then he may leave you, take his children, and go back to his family and the land of his ancestors.

42.verse: This is because the Israelites are my servants, and I brought them out of slavery in Egypt. They must not become slaves again.

43.verse: You must not ·rule this person [exercise dominion; Gen. 1:26] cruelly, but you must ·respect [fear] your God.

44.verse: “‘Your men and women slaves must come from other nations around you; from them you may buy slaves.

45.verse: Also you may buy as slaves children from the families of ·strangers [sojourners/wanderers/resident aliens] or ·foreigners [or tenants] living in your land. ·These child slaves will belong to you [Those born in your land will be your property],

46.verse: and you may even ·pass them on to your children after you die [will them to your children]; you can make them slaves forever. But you must not ·rule [exercise dominion] cruelly over your own ·people [brothers; kinsmen], the ·Israelites [sons/children of Israel].

47.verse: “‘Suppose a ·stranger [sojourner/wanderer/resident alien] or ·foreigner [or tenant] among you becomes rich. If ·someone in your country [a brother/kinsman] becomes so poor that he has to sell himself as a slave to the ·foreigner [sojourner; wanderer; resident alien] living among you or to a member of the ·foreigner’s [sojourner’s; wanderer’s; resident alien’s] family,

48.verse: ·the poor person has the right to be bought back and become free [after he is sold he has the right of redemption]. One of his relatives may ·buy him back [redeem him]:

49.verse: His uncle, his uncle’s son, or any one of his close relatives may ·buy him back [redeem him]. Or, if he gets enough money, he may pay the money to ·free [redeem] himself.

50.verse: “‘He and the one who bought him must ·count [calculate] the time from when he sold himself up to the next year of Jubilee. Use that number to decide the price, because the person really only hired himself out for a certain number of years.

51.verse: If there are still many years before the year of Jubilee, the person must ·pay back [redeem] a large part of the price.

52.verse: If there are only a few years left until Jubilee, the person must pay a small part of the first price.

53.verse: But he will live like a hired person with ·the foreigner [him] every year; don’t let the ·foreigner [him] ·rule [exercise dominion] cruelly over him.

54.verse: “‘Even if no one ·buys him back [redeems him], at the year of Jubilee, he and his children will ·become free [go out].

55.verse: This is because the ·people [sons; children] of Israel are servants to me. They are my servants, whom I brought out of Egypt. I am the LORD your God.

1.verse: Rewards for Obeying God - “‘Don’t make idols for yourselves or set up ·statues [carved images] or ·memorials [pillars]. Don’t put stone statues in your land to bow down to, because I am the LORD your God [19:4; Ex. 20:4–6; Deut. 5:8–10].

2.verse: “‘·Remember [Keep; Guard] my Sabbaths, and ·respect [fear] my ·Holy Place [sanctuary; 19:3, 30; 23:3; Ex. 20:8–14; Deut. 5:12–15]. I am the LORD.

3.verse: “‘If you ·remember [keep; guard] my ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and commands and obey them,

4.verse: I will give you rains at the right season [Deut. 11:14]; the land will produce crops, and the trees of the field will produce their fruit.

5.verse: Your threshing will continue until the grape harvest, and your grape harvest will continue until it is time to plant. Then you will have plenty to eat and live ·safely [securely] in your land.

6.verse: I will give peace to your country; you will lie down ·in peace, and no one will make you afraid [and not be afraid]. I will keep ·harmful [dangerous] animals out of your country, and ·armies [the sword] will not pass through it.

7.verse: “‘You will ·chase [pursue] your enemies and ·defeat them, killing them with your [they will fall before you by the] sword.

8.verse: Five of you will ·chase [pursue] a hundred men; a hundred of you will ·chase [pursue] ten thousand men [Deut. 32:30; Josh. 23:10; Is. 30:17]. ·You will defeat your enemies and kill them with your [They will fall before you by the] sword.

9.verse: “‘Then I will ·show kindness to [turn toward] you and ·let you have many children [I will make you fruitful and multiply you]; I will ·keep my agreement [establish my covenant/treaty] with you.

10.verse: You will ·have enough crops to last for more than a year [old grain long stored]. When you harvest the new crops, you will have to throw out the old ones to make room for them.

11.verse: Also I will place my ·Holy Tent [sanctuary] among you, and I will not ·turn away from [abhor] you.

12.verse: I will walk with you and be your God, and you will be my people.

13.verse: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt, where you were slaves. I broke the ·heavy weights that were on your shoulders [bars of your yoke] and let you walk ·proudly [erect; standing tall] again.

14.verse: Punishment for Not Obeying God - “‘But if you do not ·obey [keep; guard] me and ·keep [obey] all my commands,

15.verse: and if you ·turn away from [disdain] my ·rules [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and ·hate [abhor] my ·laws [regulations], refusing to obey all my commands, you have broken our ·agreement [covenant; treaty].

16.verse: As a result, I will do this to you: I will ·cause terrible things to happen to [bring dread/terror on] you. I will cause you to have disease and fever that will destroy your eyes and slowly kill you. You will not have success when you plant your seed, and your enemy will eat your crops.

17.verse: I will ·be [set my face] against you, and your enemies will defeat you. These people who hate you will ·rule [exercise dominion] over you, and you will run away even when no one is ·chasing [pursuing] you.

18.verse: “‘If after all this you still do not ·obey [listen to] me, I will ·punish [discipline] you seven times more for your sins.

19.verse: I will break your great pride, and I will make the sky like iron and the earth like bronze [there would be no rain].

20.verse: ·You will work hard, but it will not help [Your strength will be for no purpose]. Your land will not grow any crops, and your trees will not give their fruit.

21.verse: “‘If you still turn against me and refuse to ·obey [listen to] me, I will ·beat [strike] you seven times harder. The more you sin, the more you will be punished.

22.verse: I will send wild animals to attack you, and they will ·take your children away from you and destroy [bereave you and cut off] your cattle. They will make you so few in number the roads will be empty.

23.verse: “‘If you don’t learn your lesson after all these things, and if you still turn against me,

24.verse: I will also turn against you. I will ·punish [strike] you seven more times for your sins.

25.verse: You broke my agreement, and I will ·punish [have my revenge against] you. I will bring ·armies [the sword] against you, and if you go into your cities for safety, I will cause ·diseases [plagues] to spread among you so that ·your enemy will defeat you [you will be given into the enemy’s hand].

26.verse: ·There will be very little bread to eat; [When I break your staff of bread,] ten women will ·be able to cook all [bake] your bread in one oven. They will measure [by weight] each piece of bread, and you will eat, but you will ·still be hungry [not be satisfied].

27.verse: “‘If you still refuse to ·listen to [obey] me and still turn against me,

28.verse: I will ·show [turn against you with] my great anger; I will ·punish [discipline] you seven more times for your sins.

29.verse: You will eat the ·bodies [flesh] of your sons and [the flesh of your] daughters [Deut. 28:53–57; Is. 49:26; Jer. 19:9; Ezek. 5:10].

30.verse: I will destroy your ·places where gods are worshiped [high places] and cut down your incense altars. I will pile your dead bodies on the lifeless forms of your idols [2 Kin. 23:14–16]. I will ·hate [abhor] you.

31.verse: I will ·destroy your cities [make your cities a ruin] and make your holy places ·empty [desolate], and I will not smell the pleasing smell of your offerings.

32.verse: I will make the land ·empty [desolate] so that your enemies who come to live in it will be shocked at it.

33.verse: I will scatter you among the nations, and I will pull out my sword and destroy you. Your land will become empty, your cities a ·waste [ruin].

34.verse: When you are taken to your enemy’s country, your land will finally get its ·rest [sabbath; 25:1–7]. It will enjoy its ·time of rest [sabbath] all the time it lies empty.

35.verse: During the time the land is empty, it will have the ·rest [sabbath] you should have given it while you lived in it [2 Chr. 36:21].

36.verse: “‘Those of you who are left alive will ·lose their courage [place despondency in their hearts] in the land of their enemies. ·They will be frightened by the sound of a leaf being blown by the wind [The sound of a driven leaf will make them flee]. They will ·run [flee] as if someone were chasing them with a sword, and they will fall even when no one is ·chasing [pursuing] them.

37.verse: They will fall over ·each other [their brother/kinsman], as if ·someone were chasing them with [before] a sword, even though no one is ·chasing [pursuing] them. You will not be strong enough to stand up against your enemies.

38.verse: You will ·die [perish] among other nations and ·disappear in your enemies’ countries [the land of your enemies will consume you].

39.verse: So those who are left alive will ·rot [or pine] away in their enemies’ countries because of their sins. They will also ·rot [or pine] away because of their ·ancestors’ [fathers’] sins.

40.verse: There Is Always Hope - “‘But maybe the people will confess their sins and the sins of their ·ancestors [fathers]; maybe they will admit they turned against me and ·sinned [committed treachery] against me,

41.verse: which made me turn against them and send them into the land of their enemies. If ·these disobedient people [their uncircumcised hearts; Deut. 10:16; 30:6; Jer. 4:4] are ·sorry for what they did [humbled] and accept punishment for their sin,

42.verse: I will remember my ·agreement [covenant; treaty] with Jacob [Gen. 35:9–15], my ·agreement [covenant; treaty] with Isaac [Gen. 26:24], and my ·agreement [covenant; treaty] with Abraham [Gen 12:1–3; 15; 17], and I will remember the land.

43.verse: The land will be ·left empty by its people [forsaken/abandoned of them], and it will enjoy its ·time of rest [sabbath; 25:1–7] as it lies ·bare [desolate] without them.
